pullRequest.title: #607 Mapping Iterable<?> object to an object instead of collection

nodes.bodyText: some textual stuff: I would use "handles" instead of "treats".. (a bit nitpicking, I agree)..
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -18,7 +18,9 @@ /** * Configures the mapping between two bean types. *

- * Either {@link #resultType()}, {@link #qualifiedBy()} or {@link #nullValueMappingStrategy()} must be specified. + * When source or the target is of type {@code Iterable} or {@code Stream}, it treats the target as a simple pojo and

@@ -18,7 +18,9 @@ /** * Configures the mapping between two bean types. *

- * Either {@link #resultType()}, {@link #qualifiedBy()} or {@link #nullValueMappingStrategy()} must be specified. + * When source or the target is of type {@code Iterable} or {@code Stream}, it treats the target as a simple pojo and + * tries to map the parameters. Otherwise, either {@link #resultType()}, {@link #qualifiedBy()} or

nodes.bodyText: Forces MapStruct to handle target and source as bean and configures the mapping.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            It is not allowed to declare mapping methods with an iterable source and a non-iterable target from java package or the other way around. An error will be raised when detecting this situation.
          
          
            
            It is not allowed to declare mapping methods with an iterable source (from a java package) and a non-iterable target or the other way around. An error will be raised when detecting this situation.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -90,7 +90,7 @@ carDto.getPassengers().addAll( personsToPersonDtos( car.getPassengers() ) );
 
 [WARNING]
 ====
-It is not allowed to declare mapping methods with an iterable source and a non-iterable target or the other way around. An error will be raised when detecting this situation.
+It is not allowed to declare mapping methods with an iterable source and a non-iterable target from java package or the other way around. An error will be raised when detecting this situation.

nodes.bodyText: Type already has a method called isJavaLangType we can use it here.
Let's keep the order of the checks same as before, first the parameter and then the result type. It makes it clearer when reading the message as well.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                RETRIEVAL_ITERABLE_TO_NON_ITERABLE( "Can't generate mapping method from iterable type to non-iterable type from java stdlib." ),
          
          
            
                RETRIEVAL_ITERABLE_TO_NON_ITERABLE( "Can't generate mapping method from iterable type from java stdlib to non-iterable type." ),
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -143,9 +143,9 @@
     RETRIEVAL_DUPLICATE_MAPPING_TARGETS( "Can't generate mapping method with more than one @MappingTarget parameter." ),
     RETRIEVAL_VOID_MAPPING_METHOD( "Can't generate mapping method with return type void." ),
     RETRIEVAL_NON_ASSIGNABLE_RESULTTYPE( "The result type is not assignable to the the return type." ),
-    RETRIEVAL_ITERABLE_TO_NON_ITERABLE( "Can't generate mapping method from iterable type to non-iterable type." ),
+    RETRIEVAL_ITERABLE_TO_NON_ITERABLE( "Can't generate mapping method from iterable type to non-iterable type from java stdlib." ),

@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@

+package org.mapstruct.ap.test.collection.iterabletononiterable;
+
+import java.util.Iterator;
+import java.util.List;
+
+/**
+ *
+ * @author Saheb Preet Singh
+ */
+public class FruitsMenu implements Iterable<org.mapstruct.ap.test.collection.iterabletononiterable.Fruit> {

nodes.bodyText: You can move this in the class annotated WithClasses. This might speed up the test a bit since it will do only one compilation per class instead of doing multiple in case the methods are ordered differently. Same comment for the other test methods.
You can do it in one assertion by using assertThat( salad.getFruits() ).extracting( Fruit::getType ).containsExactly( "mango", "apple", "banana" ). Same comment stands for the test method below.
